    -webkit-tap-highlight-color: transparent;
}

{
    position: relative;

    display: block;
    overflow: hidden;

    margin: 0;
    padding: 0;
}

{
    outline: none;
}

    cursor: hand;
}

{

}

    top: 0;
    left: 0;

    margin-right: auto;

}

}

New 10.5" Surface Go 2 is perfect for keeping up and winding down - delivering tablet portability with laptop versatility, long battery life, a stunning touchscreen, and Windows security for the whole family. And charge your Surface Go 2 to 80% in less than 1.5 hours.</p></div><div class="list-row"><h4 class="feature-title body-copy v-fw-medium">Stay connected</h4><p class="body-copy">Includes USB-C port and headphone jack. Full HD front- and rear-facing cameras let you make crisp, clear calls to friends and family, or take and share great photos.</p></div><div class="list-row"><h4 class="feature-title body-copy v-fw-medium">Get back to email or homework faster</h4><p class="body-copy">Features Instant On when you open the Type Cover,* and find the power you need thanks to improved standby that extends battery life when you're away.</p></div><div class="list-row"><h4 class="feature-title body-copy v-fw-medium">Browse, play, and binge watch</h4><p class="body-copy">A bigger 10.5" PixelSense Display with improved 220ppi resolution, is designed to be viewed, touched, and written on.</p></div><div class="list-row"><h4 class="feature-title body-copy v-fw-medium">Premium sound with clear, powerful volume</h4><p class="body-copy">Includes built-in Dolby Audio, perfect for listening to music and audio books, and streaming your favorite shows.</p></div><div class="list-row"><h4 class="feature-title body-copy v-fw-medium">Video calls and virtual meetings come to life</h4><p class="body-copy">With spectacular audio and video with far-field Studio Mics, Dolby Audio sound, and HD cameras.</p></div><div class="list-row"><h4 class="feature-title body-copy v-fw-medium">Laptop mode</h4><p class="body-copy">Work Smart - Connect Surface Go Signature Type Cover* for a great typing experience when and where you need it.</p></div><div class="list-row"><h4 class="feature-title body-copy v-fw-medium">Tablet mode</h4><p class="body-copy">Just write - Take notes and complete homework directly on screen.</p></div><div class="list-row"><h4 class="feature-title body-copy v-fw-medium">Studio mode</h4><p class="body-copy">Express yourself - Adjust the built-in Kickstand to set your perfect angle for drawing, sketching and coloring with Surface Pen.* * Some accessories and software sold separately.</p></div><div class="list-row"><h4 class="feature-title body-copy v-fw-medium">Seamless, safe, and secure</h4><p class="body-copy">Sharing Surface Go 2 with your family is seamless and secure, with parent-managed screen time limits, spending control, and content filtering - plus plenty of space for photos, videos, and music.</p></div><div class="list-row"><h4 class="feature-title body-copy v-fw-medium">Windows 10 Home in S Mode</h4><p class="body-copy">Do great things with Windows 10.</p></div><div class="list-row"><h4 class="feature-title body-copy v-fw-medium">Seamless activities for the whole family, securely backed up with OneDrive.</h4><p class="body-copy">Jot down ideas, write papers, help out with homework, create and practice presentations, and keep it organized across your devices.</p></div><div class="list-row"><p class="body-copy">Device comes with Windows 10 and a free Windows 11 upgrade or may be preloaded with Windows 11. The Windows 11 upgrade will be delivered to qualifying devices starting in late 2021 and into 2022. Timing will vary by device. Certain features require specific hardware (see aka.ms/windows11-spec)</p></div><div class="list-row"><p class="body-copy"> Surface Go 2: Up to 10 hours of battery life based on typical Surface device usage. Testing conducted by Microsoft in February 2020 using preproduction software and preproduction configurations of Surface Go 2.</p></div><div class="list-row"><p class="body-copy">Testing consisted of full battery discharge with a mixture of active use and modern standby.</p></div><div class="list-row"><p class="body-copy">The active use portion consists of (1) a web browsing test accessing 8 popular websites over multiple open tabs, (2) a productivity test utilizing Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Excel and Outlook, and (3) a portion of time with the device in use with idle applications.</p></div><div class="list-row"><p class="body-copy">All settings were default except screen brightness was set to 150nits with Auto-Brightness disabled. Wi-Fi was connected to a network. Battery life varies significantly with settings, usage and other factors.</p></div><div class="list-row"><p class="body-copy"> Surface Go 2 for consumers comes with Windows 10 Home in S mode to bring you the powerful Windows features you use most at an exceptional value.</p></div><div class="list-row"><p class="body-copy">If you need additional enterprise management and security tools for the workplace, you can switch to Windows 10 Pro or purchase Surface Go 2 for Business.</p></div><div class="list-row"><p class="body-copy"> Testing conducted at Microsoft in Feb 2020 using pre-production devices and Software. Tested with the inbox 24W PSU under controlled conditions. Device was powered on to desktop screen with default display brightness settings.</p></div><div class="list-row"><p class="body-copy">Actual charge time will vary based on operating conditions. Measured at typical office ambient temperature of 23C.</p></div></div></div></div></div></div><script type="module" src="/~assets/bby/_com/shop/product-features/dist/client/client-27ee4cd72b431428192ccbf4bf62abb4.mjs"></script><script nomodule="" defer="" src="/~assets/bby/_com/shop/product-features/dist/client/client-654f67bff6fde708a7ef8506426828c3.js"></script><script>initializer.initializeComponent({"creatorNamespace":"shop","componentId":"product-features","contractVersion":"v1","componentVersion":"4.1.8"}, "shop-product-features-5350949", "{\"app\":{\"skuId\":\"6408476\",\"deviceClass\":\"l\",\"headerPosition\":\"left\",\"shouldRenderComponent\":true,\"isDrawerOpen\":false,\"isSmallView\":false},\"features\":[{\"sequence\":0,\"title\":\"Free Upgrade to Windows 11 (when available, see below)\"},{\"sequence\":1,\"title\":\"Perfectly portable\",\"description\":\"Starting at just 1.2 pounds (not including Type Cover*), and featuring a new 10.5\\\" touchscreen display.\"},{\"sequence\":2,\"title\":\"Your fast, everyday companion\",\"description\":\"For browsing, shopping, emails, homework and more, with battery life up to 10 hours. viewBox="0 0 32 32" xml:space="preserve"><path d="M16 31C7.73 31 1 24.27 1 16S7.73 1 16 1s15 6.73 15 15-6.73 15-15 15zm0-28a13.01 13.01 0 0 0 0 26 13.01 13.01 0 0 0 0-26z"></path><path d="M14.21 class="vertical-align-bottom v-p-horizontal-xxs">|</span></div><div class="disclaimer v-m-right-xxs">Posted <time class="submission-date" title="Feb 22, 2021 11:00 AM">9 months ago</time>.</div><div class="length-of-ownership">Owned for <!-- -->less than 1 week<!-- --> when reviewed.</div></div><div class="ugc-review-body body-copy-lg"><p class="pre-white-space">Buyer beware. 
YOU CANNOT INSTALL ANY THIRD PARTY SOFTWARE.

Windows 10 S is not a normal Windows Operating system. I saw "Windows" and just assumed this Surface Go would work like every other Windows computer I have owned. This is not the case. Windows 10 S is NOT normal Windows.

This includes other browsers and EVEN TITLES from Microsoft themselves. Windows Journal from Microsoft.com will not install from their website. 
Only an upgrade to Windows PRO is the only answer.

QUOTE FROM MICROSOFT Website

My Windows 10 S PC won't install some apps. Is that normal?
If you have a Windows 10 PC running Windows 10 S (such as a Surface Laptop), you may notice that it won't install apps from outside the Microsoft Store. Don't worrythat's the way we designed it.

By exclusively running apps from the Microsoft Store, Windows 10 S helps keep your PC running fast and secure and provides peace of mind by removing the risks that come with downloading apps from other places.</p></div><div class="d-block d-md-none"><div class="feature-ratings"><h4 class="features-heading">Features</h4><div class="rating-bars"><div class="rating-group EaseofUse-rating"><div id="question-5e9bdb67-92d3-3e5a-91ef-ab1842b23ea7">Does it have a USB port? class="question-list-item"><div class="question-answer"><h4 class="question-title"><span aria-hidden="true" class="v-fw-medium">Q:&nbsp;</span><span class="sr-only">Question</span><a data-track="QnA: Single Question Page" href="/site/questions/microsoft-surface-go-2-10-5-touch-screen-intel-pentium-gold-4gb-64gb-ssd-device-only-platinum/6408476/question/8f6f106c-5354-38b8-b0a0-b28348c05385" id="question-8f6f106c-5354-38b8-b0a0-b28348c05385">To Brian E. :
Thank you for the answer to my question. I have another. Where would I find instructions showing how to take the Surface Go2 out of S mode? If I do that is it possible to go back to S mode? Would I then lose iTunes? Thanks so much.</a></h4><p class="author"><span class="asked-ago">Asked <time class="submission-date" title="May 14, 2020 1:00 PM">1 year ago</time> by<!-- --> <!-- -->Anonymous<!-- -->.</span></p><ul class="answers"><li class="answer"><div class="answer-text" data-answer-id="0f51758e-918c-3ef8-8af5-424ad270ba6d" id="answer-0f51758e-918c-3ef8-8af5-424ad270ba6d" tabindex="-1"><div class="ugc-components ugc-line-clamp"><div class="  " style="height: auto; max-height: none;"><span aria-hidden="true" class="v-fw-medium">A:</span><span class="sr-only">Answer</span>&nbsp;<span>Great question! Switching out of S mode is one-way. If you switch out of S mode, you'll need to keep using the standard version of Windows 10. If you're interested in learning how to take Surface Go 2 out of S mode you can do so here: https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/4456067/windows-10-switch-out-of-s-mode.</span></div></div></div><p class="author">Answered <time class="submission-date" title="May 15, 2020 12:10 PM">1 year ago</time> by<!-- --> <!-- -->MicrosoftOutreachTeam</p><img alt="MicrosoftOutreachTeam response" id="question-1d2b0060-60bf-3981-b6e6-f139acef1d7a">Is a mouse or pencil required to use as a tablet? Or does a keyboard appear on the tablet screen?</a></h4><p class="author"><span class="asked-ago">Asked <time class="submission-date" title="Jun 15, 2020 11:38 AM">1 year ago</time> by<!-- --> <!-- -->Fran<!-- -->.</span></p><ul class="answers"><li class="answer"><div class="answer-text" data-answer-id="e40113f3-3482-3f08-8b70-1b6814576bcf" id="answer-e40113f3-3482-3f08-8b70-1b6814576bcf" tabindex="-1"><div class="ugc-components ugc-line-clamp"><div class="  " style="height: auto; max-height: none;"><span aria-hidden="true" class="v-fw-medium">A:</span><span class="sr-only">Answer</span>&nbsp;<span>There is an option in the task bar to select the keyboard on the touch screen. When you click in a typing space, it might not always appear, so you would have to tap the little icon in the bottom right hand corner for it to appear. I have both a pen and a keyboard for the ease of use, however.</span></div></div></div><p class="author">Answered <time class="submission-date" title="Jun 20, 2020 10:04 AM">1 year ago</time> by<!--
